cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles S of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest tonight, turning north then north-northeast on Friday, tracking toward the southwest/central Louisiana coast just east of the Texas-Louisiana border
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron, Louisiana (just east of the TX/LA line)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from High Island, TX to Morgan City, LA; Storm-Surge Warning from High Island, TX to Ocean Springs, MS
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana coast including Sabine Pass, Calcasieu/Vermilion Bays, and the Port Arthur area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are likely Friday, with a 46 % chance of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds and a 18 % chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible from High Island, TX to Sabine Pass including Sabine Lake, which covers the Port Arthur waterfront.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches, locally up to 10 inches, could produce flash and urban flooding Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, brief tornadoes in outer rainbands, and short-notice channel closures or draft restrictions are possible.
